div.p: On unitid, this is a machine-processable unique identifier for the descriptive component in which the element appears. On access terms and other elements whose content is drawn from an authority file, identifier is a number, code, or string (e.g. URI) that uniquely identifies the term being used in a controlled vocabulary, taxonomy, ontology, or other knowledge organization system (e.g., the Library of Congress Name Authority File identifier). In the latter case, source may be used to identify the authority file. Available in corpname, famname, function, genreform, geogname, name, occupation, part, persname, physfacet, subject, term, title, unitid, unittype. Do not confuse with id, which provides a unique ID for the element within the XML instance.
